Package game

Class ProxyObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.ProxyObject
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ProxyPlayer
    public abstract class ProxyObject
extends java.lang.Object
    An object that communicates over the network with another object. This abstract class implements the common behavior for its two primary subclasses, ProxyGame and ProxyPlayer.

    • Method Detail

      • finishInit

        protected void finishInit()
        Finish initialization. Subclasses may put behavior here that they want to execute after the socket-connection has been established.

      • isComplete

        public boolean isComplete()
        Tells whether the object is completely built, including any post-constructor initialization and network connection.
        Returns:

      • readInputLine

        protected java.lang.String readInputLine()
        reads an input line from the network socket
        Returns:
        a line of text that is the next one sent by the process at the other end of the network socket.

      • writeOutputLine

        protected void writeOutputLine​(java.lang.String str)
        writes a string to the network socket
        Parameters:
        str - the string to send

      • getAdmPortNum

        protected abstract int getAdmPortNum()
        The default port number on the server machine that will be used in making the connection. Hopefully, each game will have a different number so that we don't have games confusing each other. (If we wanted to do this "right", we'd have reserve one with the system administrator.) For now, each game should select a somewhat random integer. FOR A GIVEN GAME, THE ProxyGame AND ProxyPlayer CLASSES SHOULD RETURN THE SAME VALUE.
        Returns:

      • connectAsServer

        protected void connectAsServer()
        Connect to a process as the server. This entails "camping" on a port number and waiting for a client to request service.

      • connectAsClient

        protected void connectAsClient​(java.lang.String hostName)
        Connect to a process as a client.This entails requesting a connection from a server and waiting for it to be established.
        Parameters:
        hostName -

      • parseCommand

        protected static java.lang.String parseCommand​(java.lang.String str)
        Extracts the "command name" portion of a string. For example, if the string is " funny 3 55 8 -2", then the string "funny" will be returned. It is expected that the method will be used to decode messages between ProxyGame and ProxyPlayer objects that are sent over the network.
        Parameters:
        str - the string to parse
        Returns:
        the command--which is the first (blank-delimited) word of the string

      • parseArgs

        protected static int[] parseArgs​(java.lang.String str)
        Extracts the "numeric arguments" portion of a string. For example, if the string is " funny 3 55 8 -2", then value returned will be a 4-element array of int containing the values 3, 55, 8 and -2, respectively. It is expected that the method will be used to decode messages between ProxyGame and ProxyPlayer objects that are sent over the network.
        Parameters:
        str - the string to parse
        Returns:
        the numeric arguments--which are extracted from each (blank- separated) word except the first. Argument parsing is aborted early if a non-integer is encountered.
